Description: Fragment of rim, foot and floor of an East Greek pottery plate; guilloche frieze on top of rim; meander frieze on outside of floor, uncertain remains inside. Exterior: rim brown; underside reserved with brown lines.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.

From the same vessel as Boston, MFA 88.825 and 88.841 and Oxford, Ashmolean Museum AN1925.608c (see Walter-Karydi, Samos VI.1, 1973, 139 no. 731, pl. 97.731, erroneously classified as Chian). Özer 2004, 200, classifies the plate as transitional between LWG and black-figure and dates it to 570-60BC. Özer, B. 2004, ‘Clazomenian and related black-figured pottery from Klazomenai: preliminary observations’, in A.Moustaka,E.Skarlatidou, M.-C.Tzannes,Y.Ersoy (Eds), Klazomenai, Teos and Abdera:Metropoleis and Colony,Thessaloniki, 199–219.Özer, B. 2004, ‘Clazomenian and related black-figured pottery from Klazomenai: preliminary observations’, in A. Moustaka, E. Skarlatidou, M.-C. Tzannes,Y. Ersoy (eds), Klazomenai, Teos and Abdera: Metropoleis and Colony,Thessaloniki, 199–219.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 102, pl. XXX, no. 308.1)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.677)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
